info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 01 at 6:25AM PDT until September 01 at 8:15AM PDT by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 AM MST/815 AM PDT/ THIS MORNING FOR NORTHWESTERN MOHAVE AND CENTRAL CLARK COUNTIES... At 625 AM MST /625 AM PDT/, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicate heavy rain from thunderstorms around Boulder City has weakened and moved northeast. However, runoff and flash flooding from the earlier heavy rain is ongoing. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Boulder City, Las Vegas Bay, Lake Las Vegas, Boulder Beach Campground, Hoover Dam, Boulder Beach, Railroad Pass, Las Vegas Bay Campground, Callville Bay, Callville Bay Campground Willow Beach and Black Mtn. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
